From: "Carnage darkness" <carnage_blood@...>

** Carnage dug her claws into the soil deeply, using the muscles in her arms 
to pull at the soule while cupping her hands at the same time to bring loads 
of dire and pieces of root up to be thrown away.
Her hind legs were planted firmly on the ground to support her weight and 
keep her ballenced while she worked, her eyes set on where her claws would 
strike into the dround next. Determined to get this done before the hole had 
the chance to fill with rain water and become a mucky mess.
Carnage enjoyed the feeling of her muscles at work, reminding her of all the 
feasts she had to perform before they got that way. She had earned many 
metals in her time, some for honor, some for valor, or some in feats that 
she would rather not remember. Ones which were given to her because she was 
the only one in the squad to survive. Yes, she had many of those metals. But 
that's what you get when you survive missions which had been classified as 
suicide draws.
But her mind had always learned to leave the past in the past and to focus 
on what she was doing, and that was making sure that their meal wasn't 
spoiled.
Carnage's motions stopped slightly for a second when she heard Teltoli speak 
up, wondering just how nervouse the fuzor had to be to battle like she was. 
She didn't mind it when Teltoli went on about things but when it was just 
pure dribble it was wiser to keep her lips sealed.
But what came out of Teltoli's mouth this evening was rather a...mixture of 
both sounds and actual words. Making it so that Carnage had to stop digging 
for a few moments and see if she could make sense out of what the fuzor was 
trying to say.
So, it turned out that, indeed, Teltoli was asking her to teach her the 
ethics of battle. Thinking to herself that it was about time she asked, she 
was getting tired of waiting.
Carnage looked Teltoli over for a final second before going back to the hole 
she was digging, digging a little harder but not giving her friend a final 
answer just yet. Thinking that Teltoli was in for the training of her 
life.** " I hope you know what you're asking for?" ** Her training would be 
hard and brutal, and she was garonteed to shed mech-fluid at one time or 
another.
Carnage knew that, if Teltoli decided to go ahead with this, that she would 
be getting into the hard stuff pretty fast. Especially when pain was the 
first thing that she would have to learn how to controle. As well as her 
feelings and emotions.**
